title: How to Make Fanesca

steps.headline: Place the fish in a large bowl filled with water.
Soak the fish for 4 hours and then empty the water from the bowl.
Refill the bowl with fresh water.
Continue soaking the fish for a total of 12 hours, emptying and refilling the water at 4-hour intervals.
Heat the oil in a large stockpot or Dutch oven.
Add the onion, garlic, green pepper and cilantro, cooking and stirring with a wooden spoon for 2 to 3 minutes.
Add the salted codfish and cook for another 5 minutes.
Add the fish stock and simmer the liquid for 10 minutes.
Remove half of the codfish and shred it with a fork.
steps.description: Set it aside in a bowl to use later.

steps.headline: Add the sliced corncobs, the corn, broad beans, Andean beans, lentils and milk.
steps.description: Cook the soup for 6 to 8 minutes, stirring occasionally.

steps.headline: Add the rice, cooked pumpkin, and the frozen peas and carrots and cook the soup for an additional 5 minutes.
Add the 1/2 pound (277 g) of diced pumpkin, cabbage, carrot sticks and cauliflower to the pot and stir to incorporate them into the stew.
Add the reserved shredded codfish and cook and stir the soup for 4 more minutes.
Taste the soup for seasonings, adding salt and pepper as needed.
Serve the soup topped with hard boiled egg slices and chopped cilantro for garnish.

text: Soak the Salted Codfish Place the fish in a large bowl filled with water.  Soak the fish for 4 hours and then empty the water from the bowl.  Refill the bowl with fresh water.  Continue soaking the fish for a total of 12 hours, emptying and refilling the water at 4-hour intervals.  Cook the Fanesca Heat the oil in a large stockpot or Dutch oven.  Add the onion, garlic, green pepper and cilantro, cooking and stirring with a wooden spoon for 2 to 3 minutes.  Add the salted codfish and cook for another 5 minutes.  Add the fish stock and simmer the liquid for 10 minutes.  Remove half of the codfish and shred it with a fork. Set it aside in a bowl to use later. Add the sliced corncobs, the corn, broad beans, Andean beans, lentils and milk. Cook the soup for 6 to 8 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the rice, cooked pumpkin, and the frozen peas and carrots and cook the soup for an additional 5 minutes.  Add the 1/2 pound (277 g) of diced pumpkin, cabbage, carrot sticks and cauliflower to the pot and stir to incorporate them into the stew.  Add the reserved shredded codfish and cook and stir the soup for 4 more minutes.  Taste the soup for seasonings, adding salt and pepper as needed.  Serve the soup topped with hard boiled egg slices and chopped cilantro for garnish.
